Nikon AF-S NIKKOR 50mm F/1.8G Lens

It won’t be an exaggeration to say that the lenses are the photographer’s delight. And when the lenses are light weighted and portable as Nikon 50mm 1.8G is, you as a photographer will certainly adore it. Wearing the super integrated coating of Nikon, AF-S Nikkor 50mm f.1.8G is a prime lens with a fixed focal length of 50mm.

 

On the one hand where, the f/1.8 allows you to take stunning images in even low light conditions, the silent wave motor adds a splendid and fast auto-focus element to your photography on the other. Moreover, isn’t it a matter of sheer joy that this compact FX format lens is not only well compatible with the entire DX format Nikon DSLRs but also extends the focal length to 75mm when put on DX format digital SLRs. Belonging to the Nikon F-Mount family, AF-S Nikkor 50mm f.1.8G comes with a two year Nikon India warranty.

 

Prime Lens

Nikon 50mm 1.8G is a Prime lens with 50mm of the focal length. With 50mm you get the view of angle, which is to a great extent similar to that of the human eye. Unlike various zoom lenses, Prime lenses are very different. It consists of a fixed focal length, which means that you will have to move closer to your subject, should you want to click a close-shot. In simple words, the Prime lenses do not work like the zoom lenses. Did you know that Prime lenses are great, in case, you want to enhance your photo composition skills? The reason being, a Prime lens makes you change your places from where you are clicking, in order to click your images from various different angles.

 

Aperture – f/1.8

We will all agree to the fact that clicking in the rainy season or in a cloudy weather for that matter, is something which brings a smile on our face. But what to do with the low light which very often spoils the wonderful charm of photography. Nikon 50mm 1.8G, perhaps, is the best solution one can opt for. It consists of the maximum Aperture of f/1.8, which with fast auto-focus, clicks best quality image in low light conditions. With larger opening, a good amount of the light reaches to the image sensor, which therefore, gives you a sharp and clear image. Nevertheless, with minimum Aperture of f/16, you can always control the flow of light accordingly, to capture the best of your images.

Best for Portrait, Event and Low-Light Photography

Every different lens is meant for a different kind of photography. And it purely depends up on the lens men or the occasion, which is to be captured. It won’t be wrong to say that Nikon 50mm 1.8G is a multi-purpose DSLR brought to you from the house of Nikon. With a fixed focal length of 50mm, it consists of almost the same view of angle as the human eye. This is the best DSLR, should you want to click the portrait images. Apart from this, with a fast maximum Aperture of f/1.8, this digital DSLR by Nikon clicks stunning images in all the various events. Moreover, you need not bother at all about the events taking place in the low-light conditions either, AF-S Nikkor 50mm f.1.8G clicks finest of the images with maximum resolution of 16 mega pixels.

 

Quick Switching from AF to MF

This is an amazing feature in Nikon 50mm 1.8G, which allows you to quickly switch to the manual focusing (MF), when you do not need the auto-focusing. However, AF-S Nikkor 50mm f.1.8G is an auto-focus lens, which tracks perfectly for the focus on your subject, nonetheless, with this wonderful switching feature, you can very much control the focus manually.

Bokeh (Background Blurring)

A feature that will certainly make all the lens men fall in love with it, Bokeh enables you to have a perfect depth of field putting a sharp and clear focus on your subject. In other words, making use of Bokeh, a wonderful feature of Nikon 50mm 1.8G, you can blur everything in background and can simply put all the focus on the subject. With the help of AF-S Nikkor 50mm f.1.8G developed in the house of Nikon, you can always click like professionals.

 

Closet Focusing Distance (1.48 ft.)

However, Nikon 50mm 1.8G is a prime lens which consists of a fixed focal length of 50mm but the lens has the features which every photo enthusiast would love to have. To inform you further about AF-S Nikkor 50mm f.1.8G, comes with minimum focusing distance of 0.45m (1.48ft.). With this wonderful lens you can have the sharp focus even on the subject with such minimum distance either.

Aberration Correction

In very simple words, any sort of deviation from your subject, while posing to click it, can be termed as aberration. With Nikon 50mm 1.8G, you do not have to bother about any such deviation, which can spoil the perfectness of your photograph. The AF-S Nikkor 50mm f.1.8G lens can effectively correct any sort of aberration.

AF-S (Silent Wave Motor)

Nikon 50mm 1.8G comes with a silent wave motor (SWM), which is specially meant for a fast auto-focus on the subject. The silent wave motor quietly auto-focus the subject with a splendid sharpness and perfect accuracy.

No Lens Flare & Ghosting

The mechanisms like internal reflection lead to the lens flare which you can take as an unwanted image formation mechanism. But with the Nikon 50mm 1.8G, which wears Nikon’s super integrated coating that helps in an enhanced transmission of light and thus, it significantly reduces the lens flare. With the wonderful AF-S Nikkor 50mm f.1.8G lens you get the images which consists of a superb colour tone.

Compatible Cameras

Nikon 50mm 1.8G, which consists of the Nikon’s super integrated coating, is very well compatible with the following DSLRs by Nikon.

·         D3100, D3200, D3300

·         D5100, D5200, D5300

·         D7000, D7100

·         D40, D50, D60, D80, D90

·         D100, D200, D300

·         D600, D610

·         D750, D700

·         D2XS, D2X, D2H, D2HS, D1X, D1H

·         D800, D810, D800E, D300S, D40S

·         D1, D3, D3S, D3X, D4S, Df, D4, D70S

Two Year Nikon India Warranty

The wonderful Nikon 50mm 1.8G, when bought online at Snapdeal.com, you get two years Nikon India warranty, which protects your AF-S Nikkor 50mm f.1.8G  against any manufacturing defects. You simply have to walk-in any of the Nikon service centres across India, wherever you are on your photography assignment.

Pros:

Effective focal length of 75mm in DX cameras (APS-C crop sensors with a crop...Read complete review

Pros:

Maximum aperture size of f/1.8 means better low light performance and nice bokkeh

Effective focal length of 75mm in DX cameras (APS-C crop sensors with a crop factor of 1.5) means great for shooting portraits

Great image quality

Comes with a lens hood and lens pouch. Lens hood is essential when shooting back-lit subjects with the sun in frame

Full time manual focus override (you can use the manual focus ring even if the autofocus switch is turned on)

Lightweight and small

Cons:

No VR

Slow autofocus

VS

Most Liked Negative Review

 

Only for Portrait photography

Can be used best for portrait photography in natural light or better lighting. For low light tripod should be used as low shutter speeds should be used to subside lighting problems.
Strictly...Read complete review

Can be used best for portrait photography in natural light or better lighting. For low light tripod should be used as low shutter speeds should be used to subside lighting problems.
Strictly not an all rounder. Cannot be used for street photography or walk around general photography or group photos. 35 MM lens is a better choice. In case of bokeh effect, this is a much better lens than 35 MM lens

Pros:

Maximum aperture size of f/1.8 means better low light performance and nice bokkeh

Effective focal length of 75mm in DX cameras (APS-C crop sensors with a crop factor of 1.5) means great for shooting portraits

Great image quality

Comes with a lens hood and lens pouch. Lens hood is essential when shooting back-lit subjects with the sun in frame

Full time manual focus override (you can use the manual focus ring even if the autofocus switch is turned on)

Lightweight and small

Cons:

No VR

Slow autofocus

5.0

Excellent Product !!!!

By Pranay

from Mumbai

Follow me

Pros

  • Fast / accurate auto-focus
  • Lightweight
  • Nice Bokeh

Cons

  • Weak Casing

Best Uses

  • Sports/Action
  • Video
  • Weddings/Events

Please note the product description says - The Nikon AF-S NIKKOR 50mm F/1.8G lens is well compatible with Nikon DX format digital single lens reflex cameras. When this lens is used with Nikon DX format DSLR cameras, the effective angle of view is equivalent to that of a lens with a 75 mm focal length. So be careful when choosing the same on DX camera like D3100,D5100, D90 etc. Excellent Bokeh. Good for outdoor potrait shoot. 75mm angle of view restricts the use in a small room and to cover a function. Read/find some more article on google for 35 mm or 50 mm on DX format camera.

(4 of 4 customers found this review helpful)

    Only for Portrait photography

    By Roshan

    from Bangalore

    Follow me

    Pros

    • Lightweight
    • Nice Bokeh
    • Rugged

    Cons

    • Blurry Focus
    • Poor in Low Light
    • Slow Focus

    Best Uses

      Can be used best for portrait photography in natural light or better lighting. For low light tripod should be used as low shutter speeds should be used to subside lighting problems.
      Strictly not an all rounder. Cannot be used for street photography or walk around general photography or group photos. 35 MM lens is a better choice. In case of bokeh effect, this is a much better lens than 35 MM lens

      10/2/2014

      (2 of 2 customers found this review helpful)

       
      5.0

      the nifty fifty

      By Roland

      from Goa

      Follow me

      Pros

      • Consistent Output
      • Durable
      • Easily Interchangeable
      • Fast / accurate auto-focus
      • Lightweight
      • Nice Bokeh
      • Rugged
      • Strong Construction

      Cons

        Best Uses

        • Indoors/Low Light
        • Night Photography
        • Video
        • Weddings/Events

        this is problably best money spend on lens ever( i use d90)!

        This is a huge improvment in quality compared to the kit lenses ( 18-105mm etc). The AF speed good and decent, and it can be overdriven anytime- I found this more usefull feature - better than 1.8D. Sharpness is good wide open and excellent from 2.2 and up- the tested copy of 50mm G's on SLR gear site must be a lemon copy ( also at 2.2 has little less vignetting and bokeh fringing), contrast is very good wide open and it's not hazy(!) like in other primes wide open apertures. It' renders good natural colours with neutral feel in them perhaps little towards warm side and not very ''cold'' looking ( at least on my copy). A lot of people say that 50mm is uselles on dx- I don't agree on this I think this is tottaly fine focal lenght on dx !

        you get all in one prime: excellent sharpness, contrast, af speed, very decent built, and I think is better value than 1.4G version. you can't loose on this and it will be hard to get more lens for this money!

        (2 of 2 customers found this review helpful)

              Fx fast lens with Excellent sharpness all across the photograph when shot between F5.6-F8(sweet spot at F8)and perfect isolation of subjects at wider apertures,equivalent to 75mm lens while mounted on Dx camera body. If you check the statistics and performance of this lens published on the internet by its users,you will understand that for the money spend there would not be any other lens to match when it comes to close up portrait photography(No or lesser visible facial distortion than 35mm dx lens)
